perturbation.original_text: This agreement shall be for a term of five years from the date of this document. This agreement shall renew automatically each year thereafter, unless either party serves written notice of its intention not to renew, on the other at least 90 days prior to the expiration of the then current term of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement shall be for a term of five years from the date of this document. This agreement shall renew automatically each year thereafter, unless either party serves written notice of its intention not to renew, on the other at least 90 days prior to the expiration of the then current term of this agreement. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, either party may terminate this agreement with 30 days written notice, subject to a termination fee as outlined in Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the termination of the agreement. The original text specifies a 90-day notice for non-renewal, implying that termination is only possible at the end of the term. The added sentence allows for termination at any time with 30 days' notice and a fee, creating uncertainty about the actual termination process and conditions.

perturbation.original_text: KCI's Customers will receive an initial VISP web site setup including 5Mbs of storage space, maintenance of the site, technical support, and any services necessary for use of the site for no charge.
perturbation.changed_text: KCI's Customers will receive an initial VISP web site setup including 5Mbs of storage space, maintenance of the site, technical support, and any services necessary for use of the site for no charge. However, KCI's Customers will be billed for any storage space used exceeding 5Mbs and for any technical support requests beyond the first 5 hours per month.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an inconsistency in the pricing terms. The original text states that KCI's customers receive the web site setup, maintenance, technical support, and any services 'for no charge'. The added sentence then introduces charges for exceeding storage limits and for excessive tech support, which contradicts the earlier claim of 'no charge'. This creates ambiguity as to what is actually included in the 'no charge' service and what will incur extra fees.

perturbation.original_text: Seven hundred fifty thousand (750,000) shares of Kingdom Connect, Inc. Series A Preferred Stock.  Such stock issued assuming ten million (10,000,000) shares total issued and outstanding and to be adjusted accordingly to represent the same percentage should a different number be outstanding.  Once the common stock has been registered, or, after the one year period applicable under Rule 144, whichever occurs first, the Company at its sole cost and expense have its attorney issue an opinion letter for removal of the legend and release all stock transfer instructions on the common stock, except as maybe required under Rule 144. In the event the Company fails to have its attorney issue the required opinion letter within 20 days of a written request from YourNetPlus.com or its nominee, the Company shall be liable for liquidated damages in the amount of 10% interest per 30 days on the value of the shares based on the closing bid price of the Company's common stock on the 20th business day following the date it receives written notice from YourNetPlus.com or their nominee. The damages shall accrue until the transfer agent receives the opinion letter
perturbation.changed_text: Seven hundred fifty thousand (750,000) shares of Kingdom Connect, Inc. Series A Preferred Stock.  Such stock issued assuming ten million (10,000,000) shares total issued and outstanding and to be adjusted accordingly to represent the same percentage should a different number be outstanding.  Once the common stock has been registered, or, after the one year period applicable under Rule 144, whichever occurs first, the Company at its sole cost and expense have its attorney issue an opinion letter for removal of the legend and release all stock transfer instructions on the common stock, except as maybe required under Rule 144. In the event the Company fails to have its attorney issue the required opinion letter within 20 days of a written request from YourNetPlus.com or its nominee, the Company shall be liable for liquidated damages in the amount of 10% interest per 30 days on the value of the shares based on the closing bid price of the Company's common stock on the 20th business day following the date it receives written notice from YourNetPlus.com or their nominee. The damages shall accrue until the transfer agent receives the opinion letter. Alternatively, at YourNetPlus.com's discretion, KCI may provide a cash payment equivalent to the shares' value at the time of the request, foregoing the need for the opinion letter.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces conflicting remedies for the failure to issue the opinion letter. The original clause specifies liquidated damages of 10% interest per 30 days. The added sentence offers an alternative, where KCI can provide a cash payment instead. This creates ambiguity regarding which remedy YourNetPlus.com can pursue if KCI fails to issue the opinion letter, or whether KCI has the right to choose the remedy.
